ddss2.chef_de_cuisine.69E02EB1868B6E83.6: Welcome to the cooking and fishing class! Here, we will expand our cooking skills so that we can survive and get as many hearts as possible.
We're going to have so much fun exploring aquaculture fishing techniques to make our fish dishes even more delicious and to discover amazing treasures!
ddss2.chef_de_cuisine.69E02EB1868B6E83.5: Salt can be produced very easily using water. However, it can also be found in block form in rivers and lakes. Later on, you can use a fluid mixer and solidifier to make salt blocks from water.
To make wheat flour, you simply need to grind the wheat using either a mortar or a machine. I'm sure I don't need to explain to a professional like you how to obtain wheat.
This chapter begins once you have completed the Tier 0 quest: "Chefs Workstation!".
ddss2.chef_de_cuisine.69E02EB1868B6E83.1: Obtaining milk is just as easy as with other packs. Cows are your best option for now, and the milk you obtain can then be crafted into Fresh Milk.
Soy milk is a great option if you're looking to cut out cows from your diet, and the good news is, this is totally doable without even needing T1 machines!
ddss2.chef_de_cuisine.69E02EB1868B6E83.0: The Pack Creator is from Switzerland, so it's always about cheese, right? :D
Make cheese by mixing milk and salt together, and make butter by heating milk in a pan.
I know making butter can't be that simple, but it's all good. We're not trying to impress Gordon Ramsey here.
ddss2.chef_de_cuisine.69E02EB1868B6E83.3: All you need to make a little dough is salt, water, and wheat flour.
ddss2.chef_de_cuisine.69E02EB1868B6E83.1: So, whether you want to make bread or toast bread, you've got to knead the dough into a raw bread shape first. Then you can either bake it directly in the oven to make bread, or mix it with butter to make toast bread.
ddss2.chef_de_cuisine.69E02EB1868B6E83.4: Toast is delicious as it is, but when you cut it into slices, you can do so much more with them! For example, you could make a delicious cheese toastie!
So.. cut your toast into slices and add cheese!

ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.title: Tier 0 -> Main Questline
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.06F9BD392: Welcome To Dungeons, Dragons ans Space Shuttles 2!

Welcome to DDSS 2! This questbook will guide you step by step through this incredible modpack! You will use the variety of incredibly numerous mods (and dimensions!) that you may have never touched before. Get ready for a long and exciting adventure!

This pack combines most of the tech, magic and adventure mods to make it feel like a complete game rather than a bunch of mods thrown together. The quest book is divided into 6 chapters that cover all the important topics and things you need to work your way through this progression system. This also applies to the different dimensions that gradually become important. Therefore, be aware that some mods, such as Blood Magic, can only be started at a certain tech-magic level.

Also keep in mind this is a hardcore adventure and expert quest-pack. Highly recommended to have at least a basic knowledge about modded minecraft and perhaps not the expectation of playing through this modpack in a week^^
This is a simple check-mark quest. Confirm in the upper left corner to continue. All mandatory quests are shaped like this one.
Special thanks to sporefreak for reworking the DDSS2 logo <3
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.776451C77: Quests with a round border are completely optional and up to you. However, they sometimes have good rewards...
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.4A8B01968: This is a typical choice reward quest. To be able to choose something you must first complete the quest.
The Tinkers and Silents Starter Kit provides you with basic iron tools and close combat weapons, as well as repair kits and 20 torches.

The Inspector Gadget Starter Kit gives you a Golden Exchanger (which you can repair with gold in an anvil), a torch launcher (filled with 40 torches) and a Crossbow with 30 Arrows. However, in this kit there are no tools or other weapons so you have to start with vanilla tools, which you craft as usual up to iron.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.37E2019C3: After all the information and goodies you've received, let's finally get started!
As you can see, the quest asks for 2 logs.
What kind of logs doesn't matter because it accepts ANY logs through the tag system. (Formerly known as oredict) You will encounter this in quests quite often.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.68D5B65CD: Artisan sifters are cheap to make and suitable to get a lot of flint quickly through gravel or to get various seeds.
Craft an artisan sifter from flint (or material of your choice) and find some gravel.
You can make all the artisan tools you need from flint, which is a good alternative in the early stages of the game and helps you to save valuable materials.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.401754560: In case you're unlucky finding some seeds, use your shears to obtain grass and the artisan sifter to craft them.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.561E69BE9: P8 juice is cheap to produce as it can be made from any vegetable.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.14250DBDA: Well, what did you expect when you combine potatoes with sticks. /shrug
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.3699F9707: Before you settle down somewhere we need certain basic materials and a workbench so that we can get off to a good start!
Tinkers Crafting-Station acts like a normal crafting table however it will keep its inventory when the GUI is closed.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.292E4BC09: A bucket made of clay. Easy to craft and versatile. However, it breaks when you empty hot liquids like lava with it.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.14BF0A0DA: A furnace and some bricks. I don't think there's much to be said for such an expert veteran like you!
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.4469F1066: Mortars and knives are other artisan tools that are especially important during the early stages of the game.
There are a lot of different artisan tools but we will not go into each one with quests. The basic rule is: better material = better durability.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.30212B07A: Fresh water and sawdust are used for various recipes. One of them is chad which we will craft right afterwards.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.22361AB31: Quests shaped like a heart are "trading" quests.

In this case, you trade the requested number of items in exchange for a reward. It's your call whether it's a worthwhile exchange. In the end, whether or not to go through with this exchange will depend on your personal situation. This first one might not be too hard.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.0102A8F56: The Apple Sprout can be grown by placing it under any leaves. When fully grown breaking, it yields an Apple and an Apple Sprout.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.3D2452E0F: As you already noticed, you got some DDSS 2 coins from the previous quests. They come in 6 different tiers. The coins can be crafted to higher or lower tiers, depending on what you need.
You can use the coins to trade with villagers or buy some valuable items in the store as soon as you get a amadron tablet from pneumaticcraft.
T1/T2 coins can also be found in dungeons.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.6C7C32588: A pair of shears made of flint. Not as good as iron but it gets the job done.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.65CFD3546: A bed allows you to sleep and to set/reset your spawn point. If the bed is obstructed, the player spawns at the default world spawning location. (unless you have set a home with the ftb command.)
But.. If you has not entered a bed or didn't die for 3 in-game days, phantoms can spawn... well... good thing i removed that in DDSS2. So no worries ;-)
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.11DD3FBD3: Fluid tanks come in many different tiers. They allows you to store any fluid in a block and tanks can be joined vertically. You can connect pipes or just right click with buckets, cells or reservoirs to insert fluids.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.749B11968: Reservoirs come in 3 tiers. They can be filled with any fluid. You can drain fluids in the world and push to tanks, workstations and machines.
But you can't place fluids into the world with it.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.1EDF43811: If you like to get down and dirty, caving is the sport for you. Crawling through muddy surfaces or squeezing through narrow passages will give you a taste of nature and its precious treasures.
Find some basic resources and turn them into ingots. Iron, copper, tin, zinc and bismuth are important main ingredients for many components and alloys.
These can be found just about anywhere and very often.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.0709DB042: Materia is an important element that will accompany you throughout the modpack and consists of 6 different tiers. It's needed for a wide variety of things and can be used to craft boosting mixtures. More about this later.
Raw T1 Materia cannot be directly crafted without Mystical Agriculture and must therefore be obtained from other materials. The Primitive Materia Extractor can help you with this.

There are many ways to obtain Materia. For example, all metallic tools can be converted into Materia. It might be interesting to recycle broken armor or tools instead of throwing them in lava. The same applies to many blocks made from mob drops, dungeon loot, or agricultural products. These include flesh blocks, crates of apples, inferium blocks, and even honeycombs if you want to set up some bees.

Automating this process is straightforward. A mob farm and/or food/inferium farm can ensure a constant flow of materia. I would suggest producing it in a variety of methods because a significant amount is required.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.3D395B449: Extract materia as explained in the previous quest using the flesh and apple create block. Or any available material of your choice!
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.2FF4C06DC: Chad and Biomass are crafting components used in various recipes such as paper and low quality plastic.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.4F77B5892: Plastic comes in different qualities (LQ, MQ, HQ) and is used for a variety of recipes. In some, the quality increases the yield.
There is not much to say about paper except that chad must be processed for its production.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.1FE6978B2: Sleeping bags can be used just like beds except they don't set a player's spawn point on use, safely preserving a player's spawn point at their home base. Just like beds, they also come in 16 different colors!
The difference is that sleeping bags can be stacked and are more convenient to use on adventures since there is a small chance to break upon usage.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.2DC72B79B: Sinew occasionally drops from cows, sheeps, and pigs.
This can be processed to dried sinew to be further processed to sinew fibre. These can be used like normal strings.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.58832A7AE: Shulker boxes can be mined with any tool or by hand, but using a pickaxe is the most effective. They drop themselves when mined. Unlike other containers, the contents of shulker boxes are stored within the dropped item, and not dropped separately.
They can be recolored as desired. Combine the box in a crafting grid with the color of your choice.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.5A6218789: FTB offers a lot of useful commands! But there are some limitation in DDSS2.
/home -> Will teleport you to the default home if it has been set. (30min cd)
/spawn -> Teleports you to Overworld spawn (60min cd)
/rtp -> Will teleport you to a random location anywhere in the world between 3000 and 8000 blocks far away even if the area isnt generated yet.
(60min. cd and can only be used 20 times)
Note that these are the default settings for DDSS2. If you are playing on a server, some commands may be inaccessible or have different values.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.758404E9A: Artisan workstations are mainly used to produce components for parts and machines. The metallurgic workstation is used for example for plates, gears, rods and more as long as you don't have machines for them.
FYI: ALL recipes that can be made in artisan workstations can be automated in machines pretty soon!
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.04914CFC7: Like many items in DDSS2, nuts and bolts come in six different tiers. To create them, you must first cut plates into rods, which are then turned into nuts and bolts.
Machines can later produce way more than you could with the Metallurgic Workstation.
They're used in most machines, casings, frames and various components.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.4C1D7695D: Flint equipment is better than leather and slightly worse than iron. Cheap and good to start with.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.6728A8A2A: By smelting a log, 4 pieces of charcoal are generated.
Each piece melts 1 item. 8 pieces can be creafted into a whole charcoal.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.314E80168: The handheld crafting table is exactly as the name implies; it can be used as a portable crafting table without having to place it down.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.4766D28BF: Drying Racks are used to "dry" meats and sponges. Right-clicking the rack with an item in hand will put the item on it.
After placing some meat on a Drying Rack, that meat will be "dried" to produce the jerky version of it. Check JEI for more information.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.165720DB9: Just a basic frame that is used for various low-tech recipes.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.1AD78958B: We have Serene Season in this pack. Grass and foliage colors will change throughout the year, and in the winter, temperatures will shift and allow for snow to fall in some biomes that don't normally receive any.
Seasons also affect various other features, like weather (More rain in Spring, more storms in Summer, etc.), and crop fertility! (Mystical Agriculture excluded)
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.6B55E6903: The Calendar is used to display the current season, as well as how far along in the season it is. 1 dot is Early, 2 dots is Mid, and 3 dots is Late.
It can also display the current tropical season (Wet or Dry) if you are in a tropical biome, or the Calendar is placed in an item frame in a tropical biome.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.07BC85B43: This item acts like a normal handheld crafting table however it will keep its inventory when the GUI is closed.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.44F4E79F9: There are many ways to get strings. One of them would be to cut wool with a knife. If you' ve already found sheeps.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.0AE0B723B: Everyone should have a ranged weapon asap. The bow is cheap and can shoot a large variety of special arrows.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.08CC025ED: This workstation can be used for better processing of wood and to achieve higher yields. Highly recommended as long as you don't have machines that efficiently cut logs into planks.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.18C90BDB6: Well, item trash-cans can void items and you can set filters inside the GUI.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.0E39CE8C2: Sandy Coal Compound and Silicon Boules
As with plastic or materia, silicon is also an important component of this pack. The silicon bouls used in the process are produced by smelting coal compounds in a furnace.
You should use a mixer machine as soon as you can to craft sandy coal compounds efficiently.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.279608974: Use a saw to cut silicon from boules.
Silicon ingots can be made very simply by smelting silicon in a furnace. They're mainly used for silicon plates, gears and rods.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.173D40B38: Like all artisan workstations, these 2 will be used primarily during the beginning of your journey until you have machines to replace them.
The Engineer's workstation allows you to craft items like low level circuits, motors and similar components etc.
The chemist's workstation is used for items like glue compound, low level boosting mixture etc.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.1C20744F0: The capacity of a copper chest is 45 inventory slots and it can be placed next to another chest.
Like all chests from the Iron Chests mod, it's a single chest only and cannot be combined to create a double chest.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.4403A5576: The capacity of the iron chest is 54 inventory slots and it can be placed next to another chest.
With a chest-upgrade you can more easily improve your chests and save some materials.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.2D7A57FB9: This modpack has a large variety of different alloys.

Some "basic" alloys, such as brass and bronze, can be produced without an alloy smelter. To do this, you have to mix the appropriate dusts together and process them with a mortar. Check JEI for further information.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.317DBF1CB: This 5x5 workbench is the first of the 3 main large worktables in this pack and is used to craft most machines and devices. Later there is also an automatic version of it that consumes energy.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.19D82E72B: DDSS 2 contains AoA! (Advent of Ascension, Nevermine) Dimensions and materials of this mod are strictly integrated into this modpack and form an important part of the progression. Quests with this icon are mandatory AoA quests. These will be mainly informative in the beginning, but soon with corresponding requirements.

This is a mod with a large amount of content. Gameplay in the mod includes exploring 21 dimensions, each with its own generation, structures, mobs, blocks, and items. While traveling through the dimensions, you can mine ores, locate structures, and battle entities with various abilities. It's a lot of fun and there's a lot to do!

You can gear up in one of the mod's many armor sets, most having a special ability granted to the player when worn. You may also choose between a large selection of weapons, ranging from melee weapons like swords, to ranged weapons, such as bows, guns, and staves. With the new gear in-hand, you can potentially battle one of the mod's 29 bosses. And some are ridiculously strong ;0
Along the way, you can also train various skills, which can grant you access to new areas of the game, and give you access to new items or resources.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.1CCEB6468: A more reliable plan is to start farming crops. Not only for food but also for materials such as industrial hemp or inferium because that will be used soon and often.
Industrial Hemp Seeds are obtained by breaking Grass. Planting them on tilled soil plants Industrial Hemp. They need a light level of at least 12 to grow.
To craft inferium seeds, you need inferium essence. It can be acquired from harvesting or reprocessing Inferium Plants, mining Inferium Ore, or dropped from mobs.
And by the way, Mystical Crops are not affected by Serene Season ;-)
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.79697FA8D: Similiar to plastic, rubber also comes in different qualities.
There are two ways to produce LQ Rubber. For starters, clay and biomass might be the easiest solution.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.255DDE5B1: As already mentioned before, T1 Materia can also be produced via mystical agriculture. I recommend using this method in addition to other methods.
T2 materia and higher can only be produced by crafting and only in certain machines.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.0439843C0: Unlike other modpacks, you have to process plant-derived essences in machines. These will soon be available to you in the next chapter when you reach the age of steam. Until then, I still recommend to start collecting all the essences you can.

Through machines, essences can be used very versatile. For example, when using wood essence, this system gives you the advantage of making any modded logs you want instead of being bound to vanilla logs. Provided you have found at least 1 log of this type.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.07385B5C1: Tier 0 seeds are so ridiculously cheap that there is no reason to skip them from the beginning.
You only need very little materials and prospreity seed base for them.
If you haven't found any shards yet, they spawn as ore between y level 0 and 50.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.485EDA98D: Inferium and its enhanced tiers already have very extensive uses for a wide variety of things.
But that's not all, these essences can also be processed into metals and thus corresponding plates or rods. And yes, you will need many of them sooner or later.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.4720A0C60: The Grindstone provides a low tech solution for getting more out of your mining trips. It is much cheaper than its more high-tech counter parts, but it is slow and a considerable time sink.
Place the Grindstone on the ground, place the Wooden Crank on the side with the hole, holding shift will ensure the crank is placed instead of opening the grindstone gui.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.4C8E493FB: A quest with this icon stands for an AoA side quest. This can start a single quest or a whole chain of them with information about skills, weapons and stuff like that or other interesting tasks to complete.
Learn more about all the powerful weapons in the upcoming quests below!
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.438BC32DF: Within AoA, there are 3 primary resource types available to you for performing various actions. By default, the GUI is toggled with the O key, but may be changed in the controls menu.

Spirit is a resource primarily used as ammunition for certain weapons. It has a cap of 200 and the rate of Spirit regeneration will increase depending on how much HP the player is currently missing, further increasing at lower HP values.

Rage is a resource used by Vulcanes. It has a max cap of 100. It does not naturally regenerate. Taking damage from mobs will increase Rage. Other sources of damage like fall damage or environmental damage do not increase Rage.
Energy is a resource used by certain Skills for various physical-based abilities.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.4D5C4D96A: Skills are a game mechanic in the mod that improve your stats, allow access to certain parts of the game, and enhance general gameplay. There are currently 5 trainable skills in Advent of Ascension.

As you perform certain activities, you will earn xp for a given skill. Once enough xp has been obtained, the player's skill level will increase by 1. The amount of xp needed to increase to the next level will increase as the level gets higher.

The highest obtainable level for all skills is 1000. Once you reach level 1000, the circular border surrounding the skill icon will become yellow, and the xp bar will disappear. Attempting to gain more xp for a skill at level 1000 will not give the player any xp.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.3400A8E81: Extraction can be trained in two ways: mining blocks, and smelting items.
These skills give you certain bonuses every few levels. This one, for example, gives you with LvL 6 a 40%% chance to find extra items when mining ores that drop minerals.
As there are far too many bonuses to list them all, I advise you to visit the AoA wiki for more information.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.1486E610F: Guns are more or less what you'd expect, based on the name. These are ranged-weapons that fire bullet type projectiles from a distance. They generally have a moderate-to-high firing rate, with middling damage. They are excellent for medium-ranged combat or for dealing additional damage while recovering from some tough hits. They do take some time to unholster however when switched to, so not ideal for quick-combat scenarios.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.3ACFF9556: Blasters are similar to guns in that they are ranged-weapons that fire projectiles from a distance. There are a few key differences however; first, blasters do not consume any physical ammunition, and instead rely on the player's Energy reserves. Running out of energy prevents you from firing any more shots. Secondly, blaster shots are energy-based damage, and will not penetrate through blocks, plants, or liquids. Additionally, while they require significantly less unholster time on average than guns, they do cause the user to slow down while firing them, making the user vulnerable.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.4AA08463C: A sub-type of guns, Snipers fire slugs instead of bullets, with projectiles that move significantly faster than normal guns. When firing a sniper, the user must crouch to scope in and gain stability. If the user doesn't crouch, the gun will recoil uncontrollably, and very likely miss the shot.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.2E743C574: Shotguns fire spreadshots instead of bullets. Shotguns fire much slower than normal guns and have much stronger recoil, but fire a volley of pellets at short-range rather than a single bullet. They excel at dealing out damage at short distance, but be entirely useless at medium-to-long distances.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.1D701C65C: Cannons are technically a sub-type of gun, firing cannonballs instead of bullets, having an unholster time, and dealing gun damage, however it is unlikely you would substitute a cannon in for a situation in which you would normally use a gun. Cannons excel at dealing damage to particularly tough targets, especially armoured targets. Cannons deal hefty damage in exchange for a slow fire-rate and strong recoil. Their large cannonball projectiles offer bonus damage against armoured enemies, which can be invaluable.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.05059FAEC: Greatblades could be considered a relation to normal swords in that they are large usually-bladed weapons that deal melee damage when swung at targets. The key distinction here however is that greatblades are significantly larger than normal swords, deal much higher damage per swing at the expense of slower swings, and carry an extended reach. Targets can be hit from further away than normal when using a greatblade, and this simple fact gives greatblades a uniquely useful position in combat.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.2DB914ED6: Mauls are also similar to swords in that that deal close-range melee damage when swung, but mauls are traditionally used for keeping stronger targets at a healthy distance instead of general combat. Mauls deal very strong knockback to targets, and swing slightly slower than swords do, but also deal slightly more damage per-hit than swords do.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.706AAB159: Staves are magical utility items that vary greatly in usage. Some staves fire magical projectiles in a similar manner to blasters, others strengthen the user, deal AoE poison damage, heal friendly players and minions, and more various effects. Projectiles fired by staves deal armour penetrating magic damage against enemies, but not against players. Like blasters, these projectiles also cannot penetrate blocks, plants, or liquids.
Staves require that the user have Runes in their inventory to cast spells from them. Each staff lists their required per-cast runes in the description tooltip.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.003A076CF: Crossbows are alternative versions of Bows that also consume Arrows, along with being able to consume Firework Rockets. Unlike Bows, Crossbows must first be fully charged in order to be fired, afterwards the Crossbow must be used again to fire the Arrow/Firework Rocket. All Crossbows take 1.25 seconds to fully charge. Crossbows can also be used in the offhand without the need for the Brace enchantment.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.3998244B4: This pack also adds some non-traditional throwable weapons, similar to how snowballs work. These weapons are cheap, simple, and easy to use, requiring only themselves as ammo, and offering varying effects. These are great for quick and easy ranged damage, but are not ideal when compared to high damage output weapons from other categories.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.514C37941: Farming is trained by either breaking certain crop-based blocks or by breeding animals.
Crops will only give Farming xp if broken while fully grown.
The amount of xp given depends on:
- the player's current Farming level. The higher the Farming level, the more xp that is given.
- how many stages of growth a crop has. Crops that go through more stages of growth give more xp than crops with less stages.
Check the wiki to see all the bonuses related to this skill if you are interested in using it.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.1539E56BB: Read upcoming quests below to learn everything about the rest of AoA's skills.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.744178BD0: Dexterity can be trained by running, jumping, or by landing vanilla critical hits.

Xp will not be earned under the following circumstances: if the player is in Creative or Spectator mode, or if the player is riding a mob. Xp will also not be earned from running if the player moves 1 block per tick or faster.
Check the wiki to see all the bonuses related to this skill if you are interested in using it.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.0C1E58DF9: Fishing with any fishing rod will give Hauling xp upon successfully catching something.
Check the wiki to see all the bonuses related to this skill if you are interested in using it.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.3989E14B3: The next step is to find some ancient rock. It is randomly generated like ore veins between Y1 and Y30. You could also try to track down a Ruined Teleporter Frame. These generate underground between Y10-Y20. Generally speaking, you'll have the best chances of finding one if you mine around underground at Y18.
If you find one, take all the carved rune blocks with you. You gonna need it later as well.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.1AC340811: Runium ore generates in the overworld randolmy at y level 1-65. It can be smelted into runium chunks.
The chunks and the unpowered runes are basic items used as crafting ingredient in a couple of recipes.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.509D6B0B3: An iron furnace is 20%% faster than a vanilla furnace
These furnaces come in different tiers and with a variety of upgrades that can make them even more efficient.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.4BA674C40: An arboreal extractor is a device that extracts a fluid from a naturally grown adjacent tree.
Place it next to the bottom of a tree, then it will start extracting a fluid. Bonemeal serves as a fertilizer and speeds up the process a bit.

The goal is to collect as much resin as possible, as we will need it later in T1 and T2 for tree oil and super glue. Make sure you don't extract it from a maple or dark oak tree, or you'll end up with sap. If you have Menril trees nearby, take the opportunity to extract menril resin too. This will also be extremely useful later on.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.388D50AED: Crop Fertility is a key feature in Serene Seasons.

Throughout the seasons, the types of crops you can grow will change. Crops can be set to grow in any of the temperate seasons, and in biomes affected by tropical seasons, only Summer crops will be in season. Likewise, biomes that always receive snow will only be able to grow Winter crops.

You can see which season(s) a crop is fertile in the tooltip that appears when you hover over the seeds for the crop, or in some cases, the crop itself. Seeds/crops that do not have a fertile season listed will not be affected by seasons at all.

When a crop is in season, it will grow as it normally does, and you'll be able to use bonemeal to grow it faster like normal. When a crop is out of season, it will grow very slowly, and will require more bonemeal than usual to increase its growth stage. To grow out of season crops efficiently, you have three options:
-Placing glass/stained glass blocks within 16 blocks above crops to grow out of season crops above ground.
-Using vanilla Bees. Bees will pollinate crops regardless of whether they're in season or not.
-Growing out of season crops underground, as long as they're below y Level 30 and not exposed to the sky.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.0D6620566: There are two ways to obtain xp for Innervation: defeating mobs, and using Innervation abilities.
Check the wiki to see all the bonuses related to this skill if you are interested in using it.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.2438FE1AF: Big quests shaped like gearwheels are classified as mandatory Multiblock quests.

The Smeltery is a multi-block structure used to create higher level weapons and tools using metals and alloys. It can be used to smelt ores, ingots or blocks of almost any metal, and will finally allow you to double your ores more easily.
What is also very important for our next steps is molten clay. This is no longer a problem with this big boy.
Please note that it is possible to pour all liquids directly into any fluid container.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.401B0384E: Your first journey leads to hell!
Travel to the Nether and get some magma blocks and netherrack for bricks.

You got some obsidian blocks in the previous quest but they are not enough. For the rest you have to find lava and create and mine obsidian with good old vanilla manners. Or you can find some while exploring the world...
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.5F1F303E6: Calcite dust is quite difficult to get if you don't have machines for it. But you have to start somewhere, don't you^^
To do this, you must first find limestone or fluorite, as well as normal stone. Then, grind all of these into dust using a mortar and blend them together.
Lead, on the other hand, is fairly easy to find in its ore form. However, it lies deep underground between Y5 and Y25.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.294894D5C: Blast Furnace! (Unlocks Chapter: Main Questline T1)
Big quests shaped like gearwheels are classified as mandatory Multiblock quests.
The Crude Blast Furnace produces Steel Ingots and Slag by smelting Iron Ingots with Coal, Coal Coke or Charcoal as fuel.
Construction involves arranging 27 Blast Bricks into a cube and using an Engineer's Hammer on the front face to complete the structure.
Steel will take us through the next era, especially to produce some Tier 1 Complex Alloys. But more on this later.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.2220F0AF3: With a Construction Wand you can place multiple blocks (up to 1024 with the best tier) at once, extending your build on the side you're facing.

If that's not enough: later you can upgrade your wand with additional cores, allowing you to place a block behind the block you are facing, conjure blocks in mid air or destroy lots of blocks very fast.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.7A0D0768B: Chefs Workstation! [Unlocks Chapter: Chef de Couisine]

Although this workstation allows you to cook more advanced recipes, it is still very limited. As soon as you finally unlock your first Thermomix, you will be unstoppable and can let off steam with your culinary skills.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.6C294EB5F: Storage drawers use in-world interactions in order to add and remove items from their inventory. They do, however, have user interfaces which can be used to see the specific number of items stored in each drawer, and to modify the various upgrades the drawers can have.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.47B0FB87B: If you want full Breath-of-the-Wild-style paragliding action in DDSS2, this item is for you!

While you're holding Paraglider midair, you fall more slowly, gliding over the land. Just like in BotW. This action consumes stamina and stamina can be increased with stamina vessels. Which are mainly obtained through quests.
You can ride ascending wind to gain height! Look out for rising particles while holding the Paraglider.
They works with fire and campfire. Don't try with lava. It doesn't work. I warned you ;-)
Last but not leas;t paragliders can be dyed.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.0602A0659: We have the mod "FindMe" in DDSS2!

It allows you to search for items in nearby inventories by pressing a key. For that you simply need to hover over an item (JEI Compatible) and press "Y" by default and cloud particles will spawn in the inventories that have that item.
If it doesn't work, don't worry! Just check your keybinds. You can find it under "Search nearby inventories for items".
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.72B590FC4: DDSS2 contains The Spice Of Life Carrot Edition. It's all about variety, not punishment. If you eat a good mix of different foods, it'll reward you.
When you eat 40 different foods, it'll add another heart to your life up to 10 Hearts.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.02AE3CC3E: Storage Bins are blocks that are used to store large quantities of a single type of item.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.246870089: Just press F7 to switch the light overlay mode on and off. This means you can better light up your base and outside areas, and protect yourself from spawning monsters. A yellow cross means that mobs can spawn at night, while a red cross means they can spawn at any time.
If you want to switch Chunk Borders on and off, just press F3+G. This is really important for multiblocks.

Just make sure your multiblocks don't cross any chunk borders. If the nearby chunk of a multiblock machine isn't loaded at the same time (e.g. on world login), it can cause issues and lead to strange machine behaviour. It probably won't have much of an impact on a smeltery or a coke oven. But you can run into some problems with more complex multiblocks that have multiple input and output hatches. It's better to be safe than sorry, after all.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.0AC228C05: About DDSS 2 And Its Mining Levels...

In DDSS 2, ores are not gated behind special mining levels, but if at all, then mostly through other dimensions. We have a lot of different great dimensions in DDSS 2, and we use a lot of them as a prerequisite for your main progression.

This means that with mining level "Obsidian" and "Netherite" you will be able to mine pretty much everything, but I highly recommend specializing in either Tinker's Construct Tools or Silent Gear Tools because you can get a lot of benefits from them.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.3FA0ADE36: These hooks are absolutely amazing! They'll help you climb mountains and move faster than you ever thought possible!
I'm not going to lie, the first wooden version might not have the greatest range, but trust me, the improved versions in the upcoming tiers are absolutely unbeatable!
But be careful! You can absolutely kill yourself with them!
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.055B66167: I'm sure you'll be thrilled to hear that hooks can also be enchanted!
The hooks bring two enchantments into play: "Hook Speed (1-7)" and "Rope Length (1-7)." I think both are self-explanatory, but I just wanted to mention it.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.7203DC157: DDSS2 has a fully customized Ore Unification System. So, for example, you can't find many different types of modded copper ores, and smelt them into many different copper ingots.

Regardless of the type of copper ore found, the end result should always be consistent. Nevertheless, you should not encounter any others, with the possible exception of variations such as nether copper ore.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.5032DE5BE: Limonite, Rosite and Osmium can also be found quite often in the overworld. These materials will all be very useful to us on our journey. For now, though, they can serve as good temporary tools or weapons, depending on your current equipment. Especially Rosite or Osmium.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.545035A70: Rosite in particular is known for providing very good early game tools and weapons. The sword, for example, does more damage than a diamond sword.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.47951B4AE: Osmium has very good early game armor that is stronger than iron but slightly weaker than diamond.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.2AB9377D6: During the early stages of the game, collecting large amounts of ore can be tedious. Later on, I highly recommend the hammers from Tinkers and Silents, which come with lots of bonuses. However, if you are looking for a more vanilla-style hammer that can also be enchanted later on, there are earlier alternatives or general alternatives.
The stone hammer can be crafted on the workbench and mines a 3x3 area.
There are four different types of vanilla hammer: Stone, Iron, Diamond and Netherite.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.54767E2DD: The iron hammer is clearly faster than the stone one, and it is also more durable.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.0E98506F0: Iron, Diamond and Netherite hammers also have an enhanced version of it, which is even more durable, but even more importantly, way faster.
If you've got enough iron, then by all means, go for it!
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.19B1768E6: Storage cabinets come in different tiers, and each cabinet can only hold items with the same tag or item.
For example, if you put an enchanted book in it, it will only hold enchanted books.
There is also a centralised cabinet manager later on for all connected cabinets. This can be used to access all of the cabinets and to input or output items.
ddss2.tier_0_.2F3E4F0FF24569B6.5D3CEA156: In the Nether, you'll discover amazing loot crates just waiting to be opened! These crates are rare and usually well hidden in Netherrack, which makes them all the more exciting when you do find one! You can't open them yourself – you need a recycler, which you don't have yet. But if you see a few, feel free to take them with you!

Open those loot crates in a recycler and you could get up to five awesome dungeon loot items! Depending on which dimension you are in, you'll find loot crates with higher tiers and better loot – how awesome is that?!
Loot crates cannot be detected with a 'Scannables' scanner.
ddss2.tier_1_main_questline.1DBF6954F499: Tier 1 -> Main Questline
Welcome To Tier 1!
Welcome to Tier 1! The age of steam.
In this chapter, we will build our first steam generators and machines including multiblocks. Touch the basics of certain magic mods and you will travel to your first fantasy dimensions.
Pneumatic Device T1
Pneumatic devices, like many items in ddss2, come in 6 different tiers.
These devices are incredibly versatile components that are used in a variety of applications. They are essential for machines that need to transfer items, fluids, or gases internally.
It' s a pain to build them with the workshop, but for now there is no other way. Soon it will be easier with steam machines.
Insulating Glass
Insulating Glass is a lightweight type of heat-resistant glass used for various components where glass is indispensable.
This is where osmium is used for the first time for components. The ore can be found between y level 0 and 60.
The engineers workshop is needed. Later, an assembler will make the production of this glass more efficient.
Fluid Regulator

The Fluid Regulator is an incredible piece of equipment that has a name that says it all. It's the perfect solution for controlling the flow of fluids in machines. And get this — it's not just limited to liquids. It's just as effective when it comes to gases and steam, making it a total game-changer!
Low Pressure Boiler
The low pressure boiler needs water and fuel (coal/wood) to produce steam. It produces 20mb of steam per tick. The burn time of the coal depends on its type.
Start collecting steam in external tanks, you will need it soon enough once you start building your first machines.
Large Cooling Cells T1
A Large Cooling Cell is a passive cooling case that protects machines and multiblock structures from overheating. It comes in 6 different tiers.
Water Collector T1
This machine extracts water from the environment and stores it in its internal tank. It can be collected using buckets or extracted with pipes.
This device comes in 4 tiers, the first one pumps water at a rate of 250mb every 4 tick. This is enough to supply at least 2 fully upgraded low pressure boilers with sufficient water.
Fluid Pipes

Pipes from the mod pipez are very efficient and are designed to create as little lag as possible. Unlike other pipes, these do not need to be replaced because the transfer rate of fluids/items/energy/gas is based on the upgrades used at the end of a pipe. Without upgrades, they function at a minimal rate.

Pipes don't transfer anything if they are not set to extract. You can sneak-click onto the end of a connected pipe with a wrench to set it to extract. Click the extracting part of the pipe to change modes, add filters or add upgrades.
Example on how to extract water from a Water Collector:
{image:modpack:textures/quest_images/water_collector.png width:160 height:135 align:1}
Fluid Cells!
Thanks to my buddy Atu1sto, the good old Fluid Cells from Tech Reborn have been reintroduced for version 1.16.5. Just like in DDSS 1, they can be used as a stackable bucket.
Credits: https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/fluid-cells
Rubber Gasket Ring
The next item we need to work on are gasket rings. These are essential for various machine parts.
They are made from rubber and the better the quality of the rubber, the more you get out of it.
Compressed Iron!
To get these ingots before you can build a pressure chamber, you have to use TNT. We will already need a few to get further.
Drop Iron Ingots and activate TNT next to the dropped item(s). 80%% of the ingots will be converted into Compressed Iron Ingots. Unfortunately, the rest is gone.
First Steam Motor!
The Steam Motor is the first in a series of many motors that will take you through this pack. It is used for almost all steam machines.
Steam Alloy Smelter!

The Alloy smelter! Probably the most useful machine for every Minecraft player. With the number of alloy combinations possible in this pack, this device is a real godsend, even if our first one runs on steam.
All Steam machines are equipped with an upgrade and a "boosting" slot.
Crude Oil and Lubricant!
Lubricant is used in many machine parts and motors.
The production without having machines beforehand is very annoying and requires crude oil. Later you can use tree oil, biodiesel and a bunch of other liquids.

Fortunately, crude oil spawns randomly in hot biomes. These include Vanilla Deserts and modded biomes such as Red Deserts, Lush Savannas, and so on. You should set out on a journey to find it and fill a portable tank with it. Take enough with you; production is not very efficient with this early-game alternative.
Complex Alloy T1
The first important step you should take is to learn how to make Complex Alloy T1. Each age has its own Complex Alloy and you will always need the previous tier.
The alloy usually contains ingots and other alloys from the respective age. With the exception of T1, most of the other complex alloys require you to visit other dimensions or even planets.
A Void ore miner will make your life easier later on. But we'll get to that in a later stage.
Coke Oven
The Coke Oven is our next multiblock structure. It is made with Coke Bricks arranged in a 3x3x3 solid cube and right-clicking on a central block of any face with an Engineer's Hammer.
While you're working on your steam machine components, we need to start setting up the coke oven and fermenting Creosote oil. It will be used for your first purification fluid. More on this later.
The by-product is either charcoal or coal coke, which burns a lot longer than coal and this is going to be very useful for the upcoming steam boiler.
Creosote Oil

As I mentioned earlier, creosote oil is made in the coke oven during the early stages of this modpack. Now is the perfect time to use it! Grab a bucket of this amazing stuff so we can move on to making purification fluid.
E-D-R-U ?
E-D-R-U stands for Electolysing, Distilling and Refining Unit. As the name suggests, this is a very versatile machine that can perform a wide variety of tasks.
Purification Fluid
Purification Fluid is used to refine and improve metals. Like Pure Iron, for example.

It's a bit of a pain to produce this in the workshop since you have to make it in buckets. We're going to build some machines soon to make production easier because we need to make a lot of this in the pack.
Pure Iron!
Now that you have the basic knowledge to produce pure metals, it's time to make some pure iron. This is for now the only way to get better machines.
Take a look at JEI to see how pure iron is produced in the EDRU.
Pneumatic Gearbox!
The pneumatic gearbox is an essential component of most steam machines.
Catalyst for a new dimension...
The Catalyst is an item used to activate The Undergarden portal.
Pure Aquamarine!
Just like Pure Iron, Aquamarine can also be refined with an EDRU and later with a Fusion Computer.
The Undergarden!

The Undergarden is a dark, subterranean world located deep below the bedrock of the Overworld. The flora here has adapted to their conditions and can grow anywhere, independent of light. Strange creatures call these dark lands home, and are plagued by the invasive Rotspawn, monsters originating from a chaotic, mysterious realm.
An Undergarden portal is built in a very similar manner to the Nether portal. It is built as a vertical, rectangular frame of stone bricks, Use the Catalyst to activate it.
{image:modpack:textures/quest_images/portal_undergarden.png width:100 height:150 align:1}
Froststeel + Cloggrum
Froststeel and Cloggrum ore can be found naturally in the undergarden.
To be more specific; in Frostfields and Gronglegrowth biomes.
Both will be used in upcoming tasks. So it doesn't hurt to take a couple of them with you while you have a look at The Undergarden.
Storage Drawer Upgrade!
The Storage Upgrade (II) increases the maximum storage of a Drawer by 4 times its base value. For instance, with only one installed it will increase the maximum storage to 128 stacks from 32.

It can be applied by right-clicking with it on a Drawer or placed manually in the Drawer's GUI when right-clicked with an empty hand. The Upgrade can be removed through the Drawer's GUI. Upgrades stack additively with each other.
Air Grate Module
Air Grate Modules are used in almost all steam machines and are responsible for releasing excess steam and ensuring proper air circulation.
Forming Press!
You've wasted more than enough materials with the Metallurgic Workstation so far. With the Forming press, you can produce materials such as plates much more efficiently and cost-effectively.
Soul Jars?
Soul Jars are used to store the "soul" of some entities like cows or zombies. To craft an empty one you need to find some soulium ore in the nether.
These jars are used to craft all the different tiers of spiritual crystals.
Hydrogen + Heavy Water
If you process water in the EDRU, you get hydrogen on one side and heavy water on the other.
Among other things, we use hydrogen to create purge fluid, which will be useful later on, and we use heavy water to make our first boosting mixture.
Purge Fluid?
To produce some purge fluid you have to process various mob drops in the EDRU together with hydrogen. Check JEI for more information.
Purge fluid is essential for filling soul jars. These in turn are used for Spiritual Crystals. More on this later.
Spiritual Crystals!
You will often encounter Spiritual Crystals when using the Magic Materializer. Many recipes that are processed there often require a crystal in addition to the normal materials.
Each crystal requires a filled soul jar. The material required in the soul jar varies depending on the crystal. You often have several options available per age/tier.
In T1, for example, you can use things like cow or pig products. Check JEI for more detailed information.
Drawer Controller
The Drawer Controller is used to interact with a group of drawers. It has to be touching the drawer bank.

The Drawer Controller can coordinate the function of all connected drawers within a 12 block range along any axis. Right-clicking materials on a Drawer Controller will automatically deposit the materials in the appropriate drawer. There can be only one Drawer Controller in the system. To add more item entry points, the Controller Slave should be used instead.
The Controller is compatible with most automation techniques including Applied Energistics 2 and Refined Storage.
Elite Bin Deal!
Trading Quest
32'768 stacks in just one block. Not THAT bad...
Magic Materializer!

As the name implies, the Magic Materializer is used to create heaps of magical items. In addition to a boosting slot, it also has a spiritual crystal slot. These crystals are often used and consumed for all kinds of magic recipes.
Steam Machine Upgrade: Speed
The upgrade slot of all steam machines can hold up to 2 speed upgrades, which in turn significantly increases the steam costs.
Steam Generator Upgrade: Cooling
The cooling upgrade increases the amount of steam produced in a Low or High Pressure Boiler by 25%% but also increases the amount of water consumed by 35%%.
The LP boiler can hold up to 2 upgrades and the HP boiler up to 4.
Boost The Planet!
Each custom machine in ddss2 has a boosting slot.

This slot is intended for the use of boosting mixtures. These mixtures increase the number of items produced. The higher the quality of the mixture, the more you can boost the desired item. The number of boosted items varies and not every item can be boosted. But on the whole you can say that 85%% of the recipes have a boosting option.
The higher the tier of the machine, the higher the mixtures you can use. For example, a T1 machine cannot use a T4 boosting mixture.
{image:modpack:textures/quest_images/bossting_mixture.png width:170 height:110 align:1}
Mechanical Arm T1
A mechanical arm, or robotic arm if you like, is mostly used in machines where several complex tasks have to be performed simultaneously. For example, the assembler.
Steam Assembler!
Finally the first assembler. This machine opens up endless possibilities in terms of production and will simplify a lot of things.

Don't worry about the different fluid tanks in the machine. Steam only ever goes into the first slot and is used there as fuel. So you can't accidentally put a different fluid into the internal steam tank.
State Circuits?

State Circuits are mainly used in specific "State-Circuit-Slots" on machines, to avoid conflicts with other recipes, or just to have a wider range of items to craft. You can change its value with a screwdriver in a workbench or with a Chisel + Circuit Configurator.
In order to get a state circuit you need to craft a Modular Circuit Board.
{image:modpack:textures/quest_images/states.png width:140 height:110 align:1}
These circuits are of course not consumed when crafting recipes.
Steam Mixer + Bottler!

With a steam mixer and bottler, you can not only completely replace the chemists workstation, but it also opens up many new possibilities! It also automatically fills cells, buckets and canisters with the desired fluid.

Don't worry about the different fluid tanks in the machine. Steam only ever goes into the first slot and is used there as fuel. So you can't accidentally put a different fluid into the internal steam tank.
Steam Extractor!

The steam extractor can extract liquids and other items from a wide range of materials. Whether from ores, coal or wooden planks. It also completely replaces the coke oven. Check JEI for more information.
The extractor has a “boosting” and “circuit state” slot.
Menril Resin?
To get some menril resin you need to find some Menril Trees or plant them with the aquired saplings from the previous quest.
Menril Trees spawns occasionally in the Overworld and abundantly in Meneglin biomes.
{image:modpack:textures/quest_images/menriltree.png width:100 height:170 align:1}
Upgrade Compound?
You are going to use upgrade compound very often and in large quantities throughout the modpack. It is mostly used to upgrade things as you may have expected^^
In addition to menril resin, you also need hemp fiber, (which you have fortunately already planted in Tier 0) materia and some gems of your choice. Whatever you have most left.
Essence-Omatic!
The Essence-Omatic is a machine that revolves around the use of mystical agriculture. Not only to upgrade inferium to higher tiers but also to produce materials from the extracted essences.

This device allows you to make almost anything. Every imaginable plank or stone, other useful utensils and of course all the metals. You want to reproduce a certain type of wood from Biomes o Plenty for your house? No problem, you just have to find the wood type at least once and then you can use it as a template. Check JEI for more information.
Steam Macerator!
The Macerator is an all-purpose grinding machine, capable of breaking down ores and other items into their respective Dust, which can later be smelted into their respective ingots.
It also efficiently converts coal into coal dust, blaze rods into blaze powder and much much more.
The device also has a boosting slot which allows you to get even more out of your ores!
Silver Chest!
The capacity of the silver chest is 72 inventory slots and it can be placed next to another chest.
Steam Centrifuge!
The Centrifuge is a processing machine that separates large amounts of minerals, compounds, combs, magic stuff or fluids into other components and fluids.
For example, you can extract the following materials:
- Metal nuggets from lava
- Latex from myrmex resin or slimeballs
- Magic dust from condensed blood
- Ore chunks from nitronite
And much more!
Steam Recycler!
As its name suggests, this device is an excellent way to recycle materials you no longer need or have in excess. But that's not all — it also opens LootCrates!
The recycler has upgrade slots like most other machines, but it is the only device that does not have the option to boost things.
Steam Cutter!

A cutting machine cuts all kinds of things to make your life easier. It has many possible uses. In order for the machine to be able to cut something, it always needs small amounts of lubricant in addition to steam.
For example you can use it to craft planks out of logs much more efficently.
Steam Fluid Mixer and Solidifier!

With this machine you can perform various tasks related to liquids. From mixing certain liquids together to creating an item that is obtained from a solidification process, this and much more is possible.
This device has a “boosting” and “circuit state” slot.
Gold Furnace
The Gold Furnace is created by either crafting the block itself, or using the Iron to Gold Furnace Upgrade on an Iron Furnace. It takes only 6 seconds to smelt 1 item.
These furnaces come in different tiers and with a variety of upgrades that can make them even more efficient.
Furnace Upgrade: Speed
This upgrade halves the cooking time of all recipes but doubles the amount of fuel required.
Infusion Crystals?
The Infusion Crystal is an item used for crafting higher tier essences.
There are 5 regular Infusion Crystals as well as an upgraded Master Infusion Crystal. The main difference between them is the amount of uses each crystal has.
The Inferium Crystal has 500 uses.
Rich Slag
Rich slag is a common by-product when processing ores in a macerator or creating alloys in an alloy smelter.
Collect as much as you can because we will need it later for high-quality materia.
Flammable Dust?
Flammable Dust can be obtained by processing redstone dust in a centrifuge. This is primarily used to upgrade materia and for various weapons in AoA.
More Molds!
Molds are used to press various metals into specific shapes in the forming press. There is a wide variety of molds and many possible applications.
The steam cutter can produce these for you if you don't want to do it in the workshop.
Salt Blocks
With a solidifier you can get salt very easily by creating blocks directly. At first it will only be useful for food, but soon it will have some other applications...
Oh and by the way, This salt block is also commonly found on shores or underwater. When mined, it will drop 4 Salt.
Pure Daisy

The Pure Daisy is mainly used for converting Wood and Stone into Livingwood and Livingrock respectively. However, it can also convert Netherrack into Cobblestone, Blaze Mesh into Obsidian, Soul Sand into Sand, Ice into Packed Ice and Water into Snow.
The tooltip references a quote from Mashiro Shiina, a character from the anime "Sakurasou no Pet na Kanojo".
Livingrock!
Livingrock is created by placing a block of Stone adjacent to a Pure Daisy. After a minute it will transform into Livingrock. :0
End Agglomeratio
End agglomeratio-dust can be obtained most easily from the centrifuge by decomposing bonemeal.
Mystical Seedbag T1
These seedbags are used to produce mystical agriculture seeds. Depending on the tier, a corresponding bag is required.
The Water Seed is one of many tier 1 seeds. It can be planted on farmland to grow water crop. When fully grown, the crop can be harvested for water essence which we use soon for our first hydroangea.
Elemental seeds need corresponding agglomeratio to be crafted.
Hydroangeas!
It's time do dive into basics of botanias mana generation.

The Hydroangeas generates Mana by consuming Water source blocks in a 3×3 area around it. Consuming a source block will power it for 2 seconds. If that Water source would be immediately replaced (by other Water sources that surround the Hydroangeas), the source will not be consumed. After 3 days it turns into a dead bush and must be replaced.
When active, having consumed Water, the Hydroangeas produces 1 Mana every 3 ticks. If it is raining, this increases to 1 Mana every 2 ticks.
Livingwood!
Place any Wood Log next to a Pure Daisy. After a minute it will transform into Livingwood.
Wand of the Forest!
The Wand of the Forest is probably botanias most important tool.

The Lexica Botania describes it as "the general multi-use tool for a botanist." It is used to rotate Mana Spreaders and view their burst paths, check the Mana stored in a Mana Pool, activate or check the progress of a Botanical Brewery or Runic Altar, and bind generating or functional flora to nearby Mana Pools or Spreaders.
Lexica Botania
The Lexica Botania is a repository of all information necessary to progress through the mod.

Holding the Ctrl key when hovering the cursor over an item with an entry while the book is in the hotbar will open the item's entry. Shift right-clicking with the Lexica on a block will open the relevant page, if one exists, otherwise it will attempt to open a relevant wiki page in the user's web browser.
Mana Spreader
The Mana Spreader is used to transport Mana.

The direction of the Mana bursts can be manipulated by shift-right clicking on it with the Wand of the Forest. There is an alternative method of orientating the Mana Spreader, and that is to bind it to another block. To do so, shift right-click on the Mana Spreader then shift right-click on another block to automatically orient the Mana Spreader to direct its Mana bursts to that block. Mana Spreaders fire Mana in discrete bursts rather than in a continuous stream.
Mana Pool!
The Mana Pool is the primary block for Mana storage in the mod and can store an extremely large amount of Mana inside (1,000,000 Mana).
Mana stored in the pool can be used to power other blocks in Botania that require Mana to function, such as functional flowers.
Mana Infused Items!
Mana infused items are a very important resource and will take you through this pack for a while.
For Mana Powder there is no other way then using charged runium for now. You can find it in the overworld between Y-LVL 1-25 in deepslates.
Everything else shouldn't be a difficult task for you.
Your First Mana Tablet!
The mana tablet is a tool for using mana in a portable way.  It can store up to 500,000 Mana, equivalent to a half of a mana pool.

Dropping one of these on a Mana Pool will allow them to transfer Mana from one to the other, depending on which way Mana is flowing. This can be viewed while looking at a manapool when wielding a wand of the forest.
Liquid Enchant?!
Liquid enchant is easy to produce. All you have to do is extract the liquid from enchanted books or tomes.
It is used in a lot of magic items so it doesn't hurt to grab every enchanted book you can find in dungeons out there.
Ancient Teleportation....
The primary method for accessing all of the dimensions added by AoA is through a portal made of ancient rock and carved runes.

Ancient rock can be found in a Ruined Teleporter structure or just naturally underground, while the carved runes (except carved rune of power) can be found inside dungeon chests. The carved rune of power is an exception, it must be crafted or traded instead of found.
If you're unlucky with dungeons, you have still the possibility to craft all of the carved runes needed.
We'll build the portal in the next quest when you have everything ready.
The Portal Frame!

You have to build the frame to be 5 blocks long and 6 blocks tall, and all of the listed materials from the previous quest must be present in the portal structure. The Carved Rune of Power has to go in the center spot on the bottom of the portal frame. The rest of the carved runes can go anywhere. The corners are not optional (see diagram below).
{image:modpack:textures/quest_images/portal_frame.png width:170 height:140 align:1}
Realmstones?
Once the portal structure is created, you can activate the portal using a Realmstone. To activate it, you must use a realmstone on the Carved Rune of Power. The stone is not consumed.

Realmstones are used to tell the portal in which dimension you want to travel. So you don't build a separate portal for each dimension, but simply use different realmstones. In DDSS 2, all realmstones must be crafted based on your progress in the game.
Note: If you're familiar with AoA then you've already figured it out. AoA things in DDSS 2 do not work here as they do by default^^
Note 2: If you want to use this portal for everything in the future, there is also a realmstone for the Nether.
Precasia!
Use your new Realmstone to get to Precasia.

Precasia is a prehistoric dimension and has a day/night cycle similar to the Overworld. Respawn anchors, clocks, and maps all function normally. Beds can be slept in during the night, but they will not skip to morning.
Precasia's generation consists of flat and hilly areas.
Four different fossil ores can be found underground in veins. This dimension is also known to have a lot of ovium, jauxum and skystone.
Here you will also find new mobs, dungeons and friendly NPCs like the Lottoman, which is similiar to a vanilla villager. However, they have their own currency.
AoA Currency

There are various merchants in AoA. Some in certain dimensions and others wander around the overworld. They all have their own currency and accept nothing else. This currency drops from various entities in AoA dimensions or can be found in dungeons there. You can also convert DDSS 2 coins to AoA coins, but this will cost you a few materials. But the good thing is you can boost them!
AOA NPCs trade with the following coins:
-Copper Coins
-Silver Coins
-Gold Coins
-Lunaver Coins
Floral Obedience Stick
The Floral Obedience Stick is a tool that will bind all generating flowers in its range to it when used on any mana spreader, and do the same for functional flowers when used on a manapool.
Manaseer Monocle
The Manaseer Monocle is a "bauble" item. When equipped in the baubles amulet slot, it shows nearby mana bursts (even those out of line of sight) and the functional radii of flowers to the player.
Manasteel Shears

The Manasteel Shears is a tool that uses Mana from Mana Tablet or any other Mana providing item in the player's inventory to prevent item damage or repair itself, using 30 Mana per point of durability. Unlike vanilla Shears, these will trigger tripwire.
Hand of Ender
The Hand of Ender is a tool which opens the player's Ender Chest inventory at the cost of 250 Mana. If used on another player, it will open their Ender Chest instead at the cost of 5,000 Mana.
Precasias Resources
Precasia's most valuable goods include jauxum, skeletal items and skystone. Collect a few, they will be useful.
Void Ore Miner T1!

The Void Ore Miner is a multiblock structure that can produce various ores and resources using steam or energy. It consists of 6 tiers, and the higher the tier, the more valuable ores and items can be produced.
Steam or energy must always be supplied to the main block. The same applies to extracting items from the machine. This means this specific multiblock has no hatches or ports.
Check the next optional quest to see on how to build the entire structure of your first Void Ore Miner.
Luminous Crafting Table!
The Luminous Crafting Table is a specialized crafting table designed specifically for the creation of your initial Astral Sorcery items.

The table must be exposed to the open sky to work. When opened, the GUI shows the crafting grid, with a starlight meter at the bottom of the window when that needs to be filled to a certain level in order to craft an item. Different items need more or fewer amounts of starlight in the meter to work. To use it, place the items in the crafting grid, and wait until the desired item you want to craft shows up on the side of the grid in the GUI. You must then right-click the table with a resonating wand, and the item will pop out.

The table receives more starlight the higher it is in the sky, so it should be moved to a high place. Supposedly, Certain places "charge" the table faster than others. It is best to craft at night since that is when it receives the most starlight.
Resonating Wand
This is your most important tool if you want to interact with Astral Sorcery tables. It also helps you to find Rock Crystal Ore in the world!

Hold your resonating wand out at night (offhand or main hand, either works) and travel the world, you will see starlight rising up from the ground in the approximate area of the location of a Rock Crystal ore(if you can't see any keep looking, it is considerably rare). Go to the center of the glimmering area and mark the coordinates down(preferably making a waypoint using some minimap mod, if you do set the y coordinate to 4 Since Rock Crystal Ores only spawn near bedrock) and go mine them later. Using a pickaxe enchanted with Fortune will increase your yield substantially. It is recommended you get at least a Fortune III pickaxe  as it will reduce the number of ores you need to find in the future.
You don't need to look for your first Rock Crystal Ore. You'll get it as a small “thank you for playing my pack” gift ;-)
Lightwell!
The Lightwell allows for the condensation and collection of liquid starlight when certain items are placed within them.

Aquamarine, Resonating Gems, Rock Crystals and Celestial Crystals, in order from least to most output, can be used for starlight collection. Each Lightwell can only hold up to 2 buckets of liquid starlight but can be used with a Containment Chalice or other kinds of infrastructure to make it more productive.
Canisters!

Canisters are containers that can be filled with a specific liquid and are mainly used in the construction of machines. They cannot be filled or emptied manually and are therefore not suitable as portable containers. For this purpose you still need to use Fluid Cells.
Mana glass is required for the production of these canisters.
VOM Structure!
Place down your T1 Vom core block and open its GUI. Then click on the processing arrow like in the picture below.
{image:modpack:textures/quest_images/vom_gui1.png width:275 height:100 align:1}
Now click on the "Requires a structure" button. This projects a hologram of the entire structure in the world.
{image:modpack:textures/quest_images/vom_gui2.png width:210 height:140 align:1}
Fosic Resonator

The Fosic Resonator is used to find locations of high concentrations of starlight to help power the player's Starlight Altar. When holding this device in a hand, areas of high starlight will have a blue mist over them at night. Higher concentrations have white sparkles coming off of the block. These locations are great for Altars and Spectral Relays.
It's probably not a bad idea to improve your mana production.

The Endoflame consumes any fuel dropped in a 7×7×7 area around it, then produces 3 Mana every 2 ticks for half of the fuel's burn time (30 Mana every second). For example, Charcoal, which is used to smelt 8 items, is burned for 800 ticks (40 seconds), producing 1200 Mana.

The flower doesn't consume fuel while it's active. Fuels that leave a container or other byproduct behind (such as Lava Buckets) will not be consumed. Fuels with burn time longer than 32,000 ticks (doubled value of a Block of Coal) will have their burn time reduced down to that value.
Endoflames can store 300 Mana internally and they can be bound to a Mana Spreader within 6 blocks of itself to transfer its Mana.
Air Compressor!

An Air Compressor is the foundation of pneumaticcraft. It is used to create compressed air from items that burn in a furnace. Copressors are split into two tiers: Normal and Advanced. Normal ones can only withstand 5.0 bar of pressure. Advanced compressors can withstand 20.0 bar of pressure and operate faster.
The centre slot is used for fuel. The four slots on the left are for pneumaticcraft upgrades.
Charging Station!
The Charging Station is used to charge or discharge Pneumatic-Craft items like the Air Canister, Amadron Tablet etc.

Unlike other charging systems, the Charging Station will equalize the pressure in the two items which means that in order to achieve a higher pressure in an item, a higher network pressure must be acheived. This goes as well for discharging items. A low pressure Air Canister cannot pressurize a higher pressure network.
Amadron Tablet
In DDSS2 the Amadron tablet is used as an ingame shop and allows you to buy various things for DDSS2 coins which are then delivered with a drone.

All you have to do is hold the Amadron tablet in your hand and select a chest with shift-right click. Place all the coins in this box so that the drone can pick them up when you place an order. The drone will then deliver the desired items in the same chest.
The tablet needs air pressure to work. You can fill it with the charging station from the previous quest.
Volume Upgrade?
This upgrade increases the Amadron Tablet's air storage allowing the tablet to run longer between recharges.
In other pneumaticcraft devices, of course, it also increases the internal tank accordingly.
Pneumaticcraft Upgrades

Pneumaticcraft includes a whole range of different upgrades. Not only for the machines but also for armor and other equipment. Many of the upgrades can be stacked. JEI can give you more information about this.

In this example, we want to apply a speed upgrade for the compressor. The normal compressor can be equipped with up to 10 speed upgrades at once. This increases the speed at which pressure is generated and the burn rate of the fuel enormously.
Stop Wasting Iron!

The Pressure Chamber is a multi-block structure from PneumaticCraft mainly used to compress various materials into others; like iron into compressed iron. It is made by creating a hollow cube out of Pressure Chamber Walls/Windows. The size of the cube can vary from 3x3x3 to 5x5x5. Windows are optional. The Chamber also requires a Valve, which has to connect to the air blocks in the Pressure Chamber.
At least one Valve is required, but more can be added. When the Pressure Chamber construction is completed, the GUI can be opened with a right-click of any of its constituent blocks.
{image:modpack:textures/quest_images/press_chamber.png width:250 height:135 align:1}
Chamber Interfaces
You can also add Pressure Chamber Interfaces into the structure to allow the insertion and removal of items to and from the Pressure Chamber to be automated through pipes.
Pneumatic Jackhammer!

The Pneumatic Jackammer is basically an air pressure operated paxel. It requires a drill bit to function and the higher the quality of the drill bit, the larger the area that can be removed in one fell swoop.
In addition, the device can be equipped with a silktouch or luck book to achieve the desired effect.
Liquid Compressor!
The liquid compressor generates compressed air by using liquid fuels like lava or kerosene. The compressor has an advanced version that runs much faster than the normal one.
This compressor generates heat, it can be cooled by attaching a heat sink to it, it also have several upgrade slots.
To see every possible fuel check the "Available Fuels" tab in the machine GUI. This tab is ordered from best to worst fuel.
Vortex Cannon!

This cannon shoots air vortices! Harmless projectiles which repel entities, shear animals, and destroy plants and leaves.  With careful timing, you can also fling yourself considerable distances, but beware fall damage!
Program Cards
These program cards are used in Void Miners to control what exactly should be searched for. Ores and Stones is probably the most important and most useful card.
The card has its own slot in a VOM and is not consumed or destroyed.
Barathos!? (Unlocks Chapter: Main Questline T2)
The Barathos RealmStone is used to access the Barathos dimension.
And with this quest we reach the end of Tier 1. In the next stage, we pick up right here and learn more about Barathos and its secrets!
You have done a fantastic job so far! For the completion of this chapter, you will now be properly rewarded!
Slime Boots!
Slime Boots negate fall damage and bounce the user off the ground.

As an armor piece worn the boots slot, falling from a block height of more than 2 will cause you to bounce back up at about half the height of the amount dropped. You then continually drop down to the ground and bounce back up to a lower height until the block height is only 2. Due to this ability, Slimeslings are intended to be used with it for fast travel.
Slimesling!

The Slimesling is used as a tool to quickly gain altitude and/or speed. To use the Slimesling, the use key (default right click) must be held and aimed at the side or top of the block to bounce off of. The player must be touching the ground. Depending on how pulled back the Slimesling is, the user will be launched into the air opposite the direction which they were facing when aiming at the block.
Bismuth Seed Deal!
Trading Quest
A Bismuth Seed will cost you at least 4 bismuth blocks and a few other things. Isn't it better to take this deal? Or what do you think?
High Pressure Boiler!

The High Pressure Boiler is the perfect choice for anyone looking for top-tier singleblock performance and unmatched versatility. It's a significant upgrade from its predecessor, offering a larger tank for both water and steam, along with the flexibility to install more upgrades than before.
The HP Boiler produces 40mb Steam per Tick without any upgrades.
Pneumatic Cylinder!
Pneumatic cylinder, also known as air cylinder, is a mechanical device which uses the power of compressed gas to produce a force in a reciprocating linear motion.
Astral Relay and Glass Lens

The Astral Relay is a "block" that can either be used to bring more starlight to a Luminous Crafting Table (or any of its upgrades), to set the target Constellation of an Attunement Altar, or to provide items for an Iridescent Altar. They can hold a single item.

For this to work right, you've got to build a small multiblock platform under the relay. You'll need 4 Chiseled Marble, 4 Marble Arch, and a Sooty Marble. Then, if you right-click with the Resonating Wand on a relay where you've already placed a Glass Lens, the platform's hologram will appear.
However, placing too many relays close to each other will result in one cannibalizing the others' starlight and will most likely create much more... disappointing results..
Ethanol!
