What would the world be like without lasers? Cutting-edge technology opens up incredibly complex possibilities. Just as everyone now has a printer at home, in the future everyone will have a laser cutter/engraver. Maybe.
Gaia Pylon!
Next, we want to tackle Botania's Gaia ritual. We need four Gaia pylons to build the ritual structure and a beacon.
Majestic Component?!
A majestic component is made from majestic ingots and is a powerful item required for various structures, such as the Gaia pylon, and utensils, such as large AE2/Refined storage cells.
Ritual of Gaia?
The Ritual of Gaia is used to summon the Guardian of Gaia, which is the source of Gaia Spirits.

You can preview the exact positions of the structure in the world using the Lexica Botania structure preview. The Gaia Pylons must be positioned one block above the beacon block. Although the preview shows iron blocks, a valid beacon base is not required for the ritual. Additionally, a circular floor with a radius of 11 blocks around the beacon is required.

Once the structure has been built, right-clicking a Terrasteel Ingot on the Beacon will summon the Guardian of Gaia. If any part of the arena is missing or obstructed, pink particles will indicate the affected areas.
Kill the Guardian of Gaia!
The Guardian of Gaia is an epic boss mob with some awesome special mechanics and rules.
Great news - it drops Gaia Spirits, which are used to craft several powerful items! This boss takes the appearance of the player's skin, but much darker, which is really cool!
{image:modpack:textures/quest_images/gaia.png width:100 height:120 align:1}
Gaia as Steve.
Gaia Spirit Ingots!
If you successfully defeat the Gaia Guardian, you will receive Gaia Spirits. You can then process these into Gaia Spirit Ingots together with Terrasteel and Neptunium.
All the Runes!
We now need all the runes from Mythic Botany in order to build the Mana Infuser! I know it will take you a while, but don't give up — you can do it!
Mana Infuser!
The Mana-Infuser is an upgraded version of the Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate. Its still a small multiblock structure and can be used to craft Alfsteel and Terrasteel.
Unlike the Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate, the Mana Infuser requires a Dominant Spark Augment to draw mana from sparks.
{image:modpack:textures/quest_images/mana_infuser.png width:140 height:100 align:1}
Diamond Promise Acceptor!

The Diamond Promise Acceptor is the final tier of the Promise Acceptor series. It requires a large amount of blood in the infuser to craft. It is therefore recommended that you install enough upgrades in the machine.
Alfsteel!
Alfsteel is probably one of the most expensive magical metals that can be produced. This excellent material offers its own armour, accessories, tools, and even Tinker's Support.
Dragonstones!
Dragonstones are very expensive! You have to trade with the elves in the Gateway to get them. But luckily, we will soon be able to find them much more easily.
Gaia Mana Spreader!
The Gaia Mana Spreader is a block added by Botania that is used to transfer mana. It is the best Mana Spreader you can get, and it lets you send out Mana bursts that last longer without losing Mana.

The Gaia Mana Spreader can fire mana bursts up to 48 blocks before losing mana, compared to the 20-block distance of the Elven Mana Spreader and the 12-block distance of the standard Mana Spreader. It also fires mana bursts less often. But because it has a larger load, you can't craft it into a Redstone Mana Spreader.
Greatest Band of Mana!
The Greatest Ring of Mana is far superior to its predecessor. It is definitely worthwhile in terms of mana storage.
Gratest Band of Aura!
The Greatest Ring of Aura far surpasses its predecessor. You'll see a big increase in passive mana production.

The Alfshatterer can mine more blocks than its predecessor, and it can do this over a greater distance, too. This makes it an incredibly powerful tool. The thing is, to get to rank SS, you need at least 1000 full mana pools.
Alfsteel Armor!

The Alfsteel armour is a great all-rounder. The helmet gives you a longer reach with your arms. The leggings make you run a lot faster. The shoes let you jump way higher than normal. And the chest plate provides knockback immunity.
Blood of Kvasir?
Kvasir's blood is used to make a very strong brew that gives us access to Alfheim!
Mead of Kvasir!

Finally, there's the mead of Kvasir. Drink it. You'll feel strange, but it will grant you access to Alfheim. And I don't just mean trading with the elves — you can already do that. I mean, you'll actually be able to jump through the portal!
Visit Alfheim...

Alfheim is a largely peaceful dimension, consisting mostly of prairie and open spaces. The ground is almost entirely made up of living rock. There is a small, hidden dungeon said to be full of gold blocks.
As for ores, elementium and dragonstone ore can actually be found in Alfheim. The latter is rather rare, however. Nevertheless, it makes things a lot easier.
There are also a few special ores, such as Azure Silver, Amber, Aquamarine and, exclusively in this dimension, Sunstone and Asgard Ore
Rune of Capacity!
The Rune of Capacity can be used to upgrade the Blood Altar's tier. This rune can be used instead of other runes and alongside each rune in the upgrade process.
This rune adds an additional 2,000 LP storage potential to the Blood Altar. It also increases the tank's internal buffer, which is always 10%% of the altar's capacity.
The Rune of Sacrifice increases the total amount of LP gained from sacrificing mobs with a Dagger of Sacrifice by 10%%.
Elite Macerator T4!
The T4 Macerator can shred anything you can imagine. It is a very efficient machine and, with a 30-40%% chance of by-products, something everyone should have.
For example, you can also process items such as Reinforced Slates into more Pile of Corrupted Stone.
Sunstone Gems and Asgard Dust

Sunstone and Asgard ore are two items that can only be found in Alfheim. It's very important to process them, as sunstone can be used to make resonating gems, and Asgard dust has a variety of uses for alloys, or can be used in centrifuges, and so on.
However, processing Asgard ore requires at least a T4 Macerator.
Black Hole Talisman
The Black Hole Talisman is a portable storage device with a capacity of 2,147,483,647 for a single block type.
If the talisman absorbs any items while at maximum capacity, however, all contents will be lost.
Universal Fluid Generator T4!
The Universal Fluid Generator T4 can accept and efficiently use new fuels, just like in the previous tier.
Older fuels are a lot more efficient than in previous fluid generators, but the problem is that you need four times more fuel with each tier.
Gasoline -> 2900 FE/t
Refined Fuel -> 2900 FE/t
Liquid D-T Fuel -> 3500 FE/t
T2 Fuels -> 2500 FE/t 8x more fuel is consumed
T3 Fuels -> 2500 FE/t 4x more fuel is consumed
Gasoline!
The process of obtaining gasoline involves the refinement of kerosene in a T4 EDRU.
Refined Fuel!

By processing excess light and heavy oil, you can produce refined fuel! The great thing about this process is that you can obtain various by-products. Even better, you can even distil kerosene from heavy oil at the same time!
Elite Essence O-Matic T4!
Finally, we can take Mystical Agriculture Essences to the next level and we can use better crystals!
It is important to note that the 30-40%% Byproduct Slot should not be underestimated.
Elite Fluid Mixer and Solidifier T4!
If we want to reach the next tier one day, the new Fluid Mixer/Solidifier will be essential. You can use it to produce Unstable Cryogen Mixture MK2, for example, which is needed to obtain HQ Coolant.
This is important because T5 exclusively requires HQ Coolant, and you can of course get much more out of the other products.
Elite Centrifuge T4!
The new centrifuge helps you split more components into useful items, such as Asgard Dust, or process new Honey Combs.
Elite Extractor T4!
Use this new machine to take advantage of the 30-40%% (With upgrades up to 64%%) byproduct chance on all things that can be extracted!
T4 Basic Maschines and Dimensions Done!
We have now reached a point where we have everything we need to delve deeper into this chapter. All the machines and important dimensions have been finalised for now.

We are now focusing on several things at once. Firstly, we will focus on the next T2 rocket and the Void Ore Miner T4. Then there is the matter of learning how to produce HQ Coolant, HQ Plastic and HQ Rubber. Last but not least, we need to build the final stage of the Astral Sorcery Altar.
As you can see, there is still a lot to do. Let's go!
Diamond Tank!
This tank holds more than 16 million mb in just one block! It sounds crazy, but it's true! Unfortunately, it costs a little more.
Emerald Tank!
But wait, there's more! The Emerald Tank can hold over 65 million mb of fluid in just one block. Holy Macheroni!
Diamond Hook!
This is the best hook you can get in this pack. Imagine with the highest enchantments... You could travel from New York to San Francisco in a few seconds.
Niotic Battery!
The POWAH Niotic battery can store up to 10 million FE.
Ultimate Chunk Loader!
The ultimate version of Chunkloaders is capable of loading a 7 by 7 chunk area.

Remember that you can load your chunks for free using the FTB Chunks Minimap tool. However, if you are playing on a server, the number of chunks that can be loaded may be drastically reduced or even blocked entirely.
Imperium Infusion Crystal!
The Imperium Infusion Crystal is extremely durable and can be used up to 4,000 times!
Energy Cell Niotic!
If you like POWAH energy cells, the Niotic one can hold up to 25 million FE.
Elite Energy Cube!
If you like Mekanism energy cells, the Elite model has a capacity of 25M FE.
Niotic Reactor!

The Niotic Reactor from POWAH is the next level in a series of multiblock reactors that generate energy by consuming uranium. None of the POWAH reactors can explode, and they can be built by pointing and clicking on the ground if you have 36 blocks of the same type in your inventory. Each tier requires the previous one.
This Reactor can output up to 21k FE/t depending on your efficiency setup.
Large Steam Turbine T4!
The next large steam turbine produces an impressive 17,500 FE/t at a consumption rate of just 2,000 mb of steam/t.
While the machine is running, it also produces small amounts of distilled water as a by-product in the fluid output hatch.
{image:modpack:textures/quest_multiblock/steamturbine_t4.png width:165 height:125 align:1}
Resonating Gems!
To obtain Resonating Gems, you must process the newly obtained Sunstone from Alfheim alongside Reinforced Slates, Pure Aquamarine, and Condensed Void using a Fusion Computer.
Iridescent Altar!
The Iridescent Altar is the fourth and final tier of crafting altar and is used throughout the Radiance chapter of the Astral Tome. It can hold more Starlight and adds four more crafting slots.

Right-clicking on the altar will open its GUI, displaying a slot on the left-hand side where players can place constellation-attuned Rock Crystals or Celestial Crystals for certain recipes. Many of the Iridescent Altar's recipes require secondary items to be placed on the Spectral Relays surrounding the Altar. While crafting is in progress, a translucent image of the required item will appear on a relay. At this point, the you must right-click the relay with the designated item.
Celestial Crystals?

The Celestial Crystal Cluster is a block used to acquire Celestial Crystals and Stardust once it has fully grown. If broken prematurely, however, it will only drop Stardust. Once fully grown, the cluster will emit particle effects. Growth can be sped up by shining starlight from a Collector Crystal or Celestial Collector Crystal on it.
You can craft it by dropping a rock crystal and stardust into liquid starlight. After a few seconds, the three ingredients will be removed and replaced with a Celestial Crystal Cluster.
Void Ore Miner T4!

The latest Void Ore Miners offer over 15 new ores on top of the existing ones icluding Dragon Bone Blocks. The machine can hold eight upgrades of each type, so it's a really fast ore generator. Make sure you can export items from the system quickly so that the device never gets stuck.
The VOM T4 uses 10'000 FE/t to run on a normal basis.
CPU Core EX2000!
The next big thing on the horizon is the CPU Core EX2000, which will put us one step closer to the Void Miner T4 and the T2 rocket.
Advanced Rocket Tanks and Engines!
The new rocket needs new parts. The tanks and engines are among the most important of these.
Cryogen MK2!
Before we can move on to the next stage, we need to learn how to manufacture all high-quality (HQ) products, whether they are for plastic, rubber or coolant. Let's start with the coolant.
To achieve this, we must first produce an Unstable Cryogen Mixture MK2, made from MQ coolant and oxygen.
HQ Coolant!
Once again, we will need our Vacuum Freezer to combine dry ice, water (or a liquid boosting mixture) and the new cryogen mixture MK2.
And that's it!
Materia Infused Plastic?
Obtaining high-quality plastic is a little more complicated. First, we need materia-infused plastic, which is made using materia of your choice and MQ plastic.
The better the Materia, the more you will get out of it.
Molten HQ Plastic!
Now, you need to melt it — or rather, extract the liquid from it and combine them with some latex in a Fluid Mixer.
HQ Plastic!
Finally, chill the molte HQ plastic in the Fluid Mixer + Solidifier to produce HQ plastic balls. These can then be used in a forming press to create HQ plastic sheets.
Propylene?
Last but not least is HQ Rubber. To produce this, you'll need to fire up your Mekanism machines again because we need some gas. More precisely, propylene.
To produce propylene, you first need sulphur trioxide and sulphur dioxide; the latter of these has already been produced.
HQ Rubber!
And now, along with propylene and T4 Materia in a Purification Chamber of your choice, you can get excellent HQ Rubber!
Majestic Catalyst...

There's no going back now. The T2 rocket needs at least 2 Majestic Catalysts, which is the same as 32 Majestic Ingots. It's finally time to get creative, unless you've had some good luck on your dungeon expeditions.
Absorption Augemnts T4!
You know about absorption augments. The previous rocket also needed them so that you could travel safely in space. But now we need a better version.
Promise of Tenacity 3!
This ultimate upgrade isn't just for your Blood Infuser. You'll need at least one of these for your T2 rocket to reach its maximum thrust!
Tier 2 Rocket! (Unlocks Chapter: Main Questline T5)
We finally have almost everything we need for the next rocket! Get the remaining few parts and let's build this thing – we're almost there!
